text: I love this song. No one ever thinks about the music in BoI, as much praise as it gets. It is definitely a fun game, though. I love the rouge-like elements of it, and that one playthrough is never more than half an hour to an hour or something. It's great for just playing on and off.

author: Sephiko

text:
Ha, i already wondered when you'll add an Isaac track to your list :D

Yeah when you die, it's over. It's some kind of a "roguelike-like", it'll get easier once you played it a couple of times and got the hang out of it.
It's not that hard either if you get the right items. But it's definitely addicting, has an incredibly high replay value and is well worth the cost!

If you like that genre, try Spelunky if you haven't already, which is a sidescroller that's comparably harder but fun as well.
author: LinkEX

text: Hate the game, love the music.
author: Shad G

text: The game doesn't really need a save system, because once you hit a run where you get a few amazing items, you're bound to beat it.
author: GameMasterGuy

text:
I bought this game during the Steam Sale,﻿ it's definitely addictive. I had no idea this game didn't have a save system though, you basically try to go as far as possible until you die or reach the ending.

This is the theme you hear inside secret rooms. It's very minimalist but I guess that's what made﻿ it quickly memorable for me. It's peaceful and sad at the same time. This actually sounds a lot like Abandoned Memories from Chibi-Robo because of the bass melody (#556 in this list).
author: SupraDarky
